intro: Mollinedia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Mollinedia triflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
